HGE::Random_Seed

Sets random number generator's seed. 

void Random_Seed(
  int seed = 0
);

Parameters

seed
Random number generator's seed. If =0 current time is used as seed value.

Remarks

The random number generator produces pseudo-random sequences. Seed defines the next value generated in a sequence. So you can benefit from this feature identifying large series of numbers with a single seed value (eg. this may be useful for maps/levels generation).

To position the random sequence at random point use 0 as seed value.

Requirements

Header: hge.h
Import library: hge.lib

See also

Random_Int, Random_Float
